alert.note: Alert for Jefferson; St. Louis (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 09 at 10:32AM CDT until May 11 at 4:33PM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Missouri... Meramec River near Eureka. River forecasts are based on observed precipitation and forecast precipitation for the next 24 hours. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Meramec River near Eureka. * WHEN...Until Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 25.5 feet, Hornecker Road is closed near this height. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM CDT Monday the stage was 26.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:00 AM CDT Monday was 26.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 26.0 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 19.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecasts (1 pm CDT) Location Stg Stg 1 pm Tue Wed Thu Fri Sat Meramec River Eureka 19.0 26.0 17.7 10.0 8.2 7.5 7.0 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. This product, along with additional weather and stream information, is available at https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=lsx.
